items.content:
Welcome!

Most people listen to music daily. What you listen to might be different from your friends. Songs can be very personal to people for this reason. Be sure to watch this video, explaining what you can expect from the lesson! Pay attention, because questions about the video will be asked.

Lesson goals

At the end of this class you will be able to...

  • ...describe music
  • ...describe what kind of emotions music can make you feel
  • ...recognise traits of music
Everyone has different experiences with music. What kind of music words do you know? Write it down! We will discuss these words with the class once five minutes pass.

Preparation

Before we can describe music, we must learn what music genres are. While there are many types, this video gives examples for some of them:

introduction.body: These questions will test your knowledge about music. Be sure to watch the video on the introduction page first! Some questions can only be answered with the help of the video.

content.body: A collaboration between people to create something.
A type of art, created by musicians and sometimes singers.

prompt.body: [VIDEO QUESTION] At the end of this lesson, you will be able to...

values.value:
• Talk about your favourite type of music
  • Describe music

content.body:
• Talk about your favourite type of music
  • Describe music

questions.label: Click the word that can be used to describe sound

content.body: Loud is the correct answer! It says something about the volume of the sound.
Hint: look the words up in a dictionary when you don't know the meaning!

prompt.body: Some music is tied to emotions. Link the words with the correct images.

questions.label: Click the word that is NOT a music style

content.body: Correct! Impressionism is an art movement, not a style of music.

items.content:
Now it's time for a Quizlet live game! Enter the code seen on the screen and join the game. The goal is to answer the questions correctly.

If you performed well during the game or thought it was easy, you can select the challenge exercise! For those who struggled with the game or want to practice more, select extra practice.

Since a quiz will be held at the end of the lesson, it might be a good idea to practice the words. Click on this link to be taken to the site of Quizlet. There, you can practice words when you select "leren" or read through them.

When you feel confident about knowing the words, you can do the challenge exercise.

If you have already finished all the questions, you can do the following exercise to prepare yourself for the quiz.

Who: Alone or in pairs.

What: Answer some questions about music.

How: Pairs will take turns asking each other questions while speaking. When working alone, write down the answers in word and mail them to me.

Finished? Give each other feedback if you are working in pairs or come up with your own questions.

The questions

  • What kind of music do you like? Why?
  • What kind of music do you dislike? Why?
  • Is there any song that makes you feel strong?
  • Is there any song that makes you feel emotional?
  • If you were a musician, what kind of songs would you make? Why?

If you need some additional practise, you can do the following exercise:

Who: Alone.

What: Practise with words that describe music.

How: By playing the game on Quizlet. Keep playing until you understand everything!

Because we have some time left, we will play Infinite Playlist. If you struggled with today's lesson, you can even play this at home for more practise. Just remember to have fun!

Now, pair up with your neighbour and read through the rules to prepare yourself for the game.

How to play Infinite Playlist:

  • One person (in this case, the teacher) will prepare a playlist of songs
  • Decide who goes first
  • You will get to hear 10 seconds of a song
  • The first person has to say a sentence describing the song with at least one word
  • If they succeed, they score a point and it's the next person's turn who has to describe a different song
  • Whoever scores the most points wins!

Rules

  • Words cannot be repeated. For example, if someone used soft once, it can no longer be used
  • Songs cannot be repeated either

Good job everyone!

Everyone has worked hard today. I hope that all of you have enjoyed the lesson. In order to keep the lessons fun, I want you to tell me what you thought of today! Be sure to write down the following:

  1. Name
  2. What you liked about the lesson
  3. What you disliked about the lesson
  4. How the lesson could be better
  5. An emoji to show off how you feel :)
